pullRequest.body:
This PR adds algebraic versions of `LocallyConstant.map`Â and `LocallyConstant.const`Â given various algebraic structures on the target. Follows the existing approach for `LocallyConstant.comap`.

### Import summary

No significant changes to the import graph
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9416251676/job/25938945763)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9416251676/job/25938945590)
Is there a particular reason you are removing all those `noncomputable`? I suspect they were there for performance reasons.

They were there because `LocallyConstant.comap`Â was noncomputable before I refactored it to take an argument of the form `C(-,-)`. I'm pretty sure I added all the declarations that I'm removing `noncomputable` from, and I know I wasn't thinking about performance then. 

There may very well be performance reasons to keep them though. What do you think?
Okay, if you added the `noncomputable` then no problem!
I'd suggest avoiding definining unmathematical versions (like `MulHom`) if you aren't going to need them.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/LocallyConstant): `map` and `const` as algebraic maps
